lines.text: [Jethro and Cousin Pearl are driving in the truck to Jed's place]
Jethro, did you take care of those old brakes like I told you to?
Yes, Ma, I pulled them off the truck yesterday. The new brakes should be coming in the mail next week.
Son, I want you to close your eyes for a minute. Now, imagine I've taken away your allowance, your cellphone, your car and cut you out of my will. How do you see your future?
Flipping frozen cow parts at Burger King?
And people say you're stupid.
[Jethro is about to drive past a tree with a branch]
Watch your head, Granny!
[Granny, who is tied up to her rocking chair got knocked off from Jethro's car by the tree branch they passed through]
I reckon why they got two sets of steps.
That's easy! One's for going up, and the other's for going down!
Oh.
[Trying to figure out the game of Bowling]
I think I got this game figured out. You throw the ball down this gully. Then you throw yourself down the other gully, and try to hit them snake-hittin' clubs before the ball does.
I'm president of a bank.
Wow, can I be president of a bank too?
Jethro that was a mighty disrespectful thing to say to Mr. Drysdale. Ask if you can be vice president.
[the Clampetts were flipped off by an irate motorist]
Now why you suppose he's doing that?
I reckon that's how people wave hello in Beverly Hills.
What a stupid idiot.
Did you say something, ma'am?
What a stupendous intellect.
That's cause I "grad-ge-ated" the sixth grade, ma'am. Only took three years.

[to another relative]
I hope cousin Bill's not too busy to make it to the wedding.
[establishing shot of the White House]
Hillary, where's that invitation?
Elly, Nature made you a girl, and here lately she's been gettin' more and more positive about it.
[on the subject of California]
I hear they got smog.
What's a smog?
[pause]
I reckon it's a small hog.
I reckon you done what you done because you didn't know we was who we was. And if we hadn't been who we was, we'd have still been much obliged for you to have done what you done.
She's got crap on her boots!
I just wanna be who I am. And I ain't goin' to no France!
Look! They's a-playin' 'Kick the Can'!
I must say it's inspirational how you found a place for the Clampetts right nextdoor to your own.
The people who lived there were my best friends and neighbors for over 20 years. I'm really going to miss them.
It's a shame they had to file for bankruptcy and had to sell the place.
I know. I'd hate to think that my phone call to the IRS had anything to do with it.
[Talking about Laura "getting married" to Jed Clampett]
You're not going to sleep with him, are you?
That's not your problem.

Good! Laura, I've got my hand on your butt. (Laura disconnects the line) Hold on! I've got someone on call waiting. (disconnects the line) Hello! Hello! (gets back on previous line) It was nobody! Anyways, I've got my hand on your butt and I'm squeezing.
Tyler, get your hand off my butt.

[discussing his theory on bowling]
I think I've finally figured this game out, Spanky. You take this here ball, put it in this here gully, and let it roll down yonder. Then you hurl yourself down this here slippery gully and see how many of them there snake bashing clubs you can knock down before the ball gets there.

[a motorists has pulled a pistol on the Clampetts]
That's real cute, son. This here's what I carry
[pulls out a huge shotgun]

[looking over buffet during Jed's birthday party]
What is all this stuff?
Hors d'oeuvres, caviar, calamari.
What? Speak American!
Is this some kind of joke?
[talking about all the people coming to watch him and Elly May wrestle]
Well, come on, baby. Let's wrestle.
[grins at Derek]
Well, come on, baby... let's wrestle.
[to Derek]
This here's what I call the Clampett Clamp.
[During the match,to Derek while she choking him with a headlock]

[Grunts]
That's not legal.

[Confused look]
Really? Well, try this one.
[Pushes Derek to the mat face flat]
Happy Birthday to you, happy birthday to you, happy birthday, dear Jed Clampett, they spent a fortune on me for you!

[in mock French accent]
Some women will search for many years before they find 'a-PEE-ness.

[startled]
*what?*
'a-PEE-ness.
Oh... happiness!
Where is your mother?
She's changing.
That would be too much to hope for.
[repeated line]
I'm ruined!
Dearly beloved, we are gathered here today in case of an emergency, your seat can be used as a flotation device...

[Thinks he's still having phone sex with his girlfriend, Laura]
I've got my hand on your butt, and I'm squeezing...
TYLER! Get your hand off my butt!
You folks oughta move yourselves to a place like... Beverly Hills, Californy.
They got swimming pools and movie stars!
Elly May! Don't spit from a moving vehicle. Wait till it's stopped.
